connector.description: Receive events from an Ignite cluster by creating a local event listener.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.events.name: camel.source.endpoint.events
camel.source.endpoint.events.description: The event types to subscribe to as a comma-separated string of event constants as defined in EventType. For example: EVT_CACHE_ENTRY_CREATED,EVT_CACHE_OBJECT_REMOVED,EVT_IGFS_DIR_CREATED.

camel.source.endpoint.propagateIncomingB.name: camel.source.endpoint.propagateIncomingBodyIfNoReturnValue
camel.source.endpoint.propagateIncomingB.description: Sets whether to propagate the incoming body if the return type of the underlying Ignite operation is void.

camel.source.endpoint.treatCollectionsAs.name: camel.source.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCacheObjects
camel.source.endpoint.treatCollectionsAs.description: Sets whether to treat Collections as cache objects or as Collections of items to insert/update/compute, etc.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.ignite-events.bridgeErro.name: camel.component.ignite-events.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.ignite-events.bridgeErro.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.ignite-events.configurat.name: camel.component.ignite-events.configurationResource
camel.component.ignite-events.configurat.description: The resource from where to load the configuration. It can be a: URL, String or InputStream type.

camel.component.ignite-events.ignite.name: camel.component.ignite-events.ignite
camel.component.ignite-events.ignite.description: To use an existing Ignite instance.

camel.component.ignite-events.igniteConf.name: camel.component.ignite-events.igniteConfiguration
camel.component.ignite-events.igniteConf.description: Allows the user to set a programmatic ignite configuration.

camel.component.ignite-events.autowiredE.name: camel.component.ignite-events.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ignite-events.autowiredE.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
